intro: Aegilops aucheri, commonly known as the Armenian tares, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hollow stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its florets are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Aegilops aucheri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
